column4: I've two soundcard devices one onboard and one soundblaster 24-Bit external. In preferences -> audio I choose everything auto-search. Gnome only use the onboard soundcard. How can I switch default soundcard in gnome?
no, I want to switch dynamically
have you disabled the onboard soundcard in bios? (sorry bout the name)
so you want to use both
does aplay -l   show both cards?
yes both card are visible
but you DO NOT WANT to switch the onboard off in bios, correct?
yes, thats right
if you run aplay and try to play a test file from the pci card does it work>?
it have to be possible to use a specific soundcard, mom, I try it
sorry, Iá¸¿ looking for a file :)
nbd,     if aplay will play thru it, then it's just a matter of gui settings me thinks
aplay plays the file correctly, but on the onboard (wrong) soundcard
did you/do you know how. to pick the 2nd device?
no I doesnt, this is my question :)
i will check for you 1sec
yes, mom.
aplay -l do not have an useable devicename
